name: lidlabl
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3
body: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(c3, cabl))

stmt.origin: syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(c3, cabl), wcel(c0, cabl), wcel(c1, cfv(csubg, c0)))
stmt.pretty: syl2anc((c0 ∈ Ring ∧ c1 ∈ c2), c3 ∈ Abel, c0 ∈ Abel, c1 ∈(SubGrp ` c0))

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(c3, cabl))

-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, cabl), wcel(c1, cfv(csubg, c0))), wcel(c3, cabl))
body.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ Ring ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→ c3 ∈ Abel)
⊣ ((c0 ∈ Ring ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→ c0 ∈ Abel)
⊣ ((c0 ∈ Ring ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→ c1 ∈(SubGrp ` c0))
⊣ ((c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ∈(SubGrp ` c0))→ c3 ∈ Abel)

comment: A (left) ideal of a ring is an (additive) abelian group. (Contributed by AV, 17-Feb-2020.)
